AllClusteringAnalysisEfficientServer¶

async AllClusteringAnalysisEfficientServer.execute(clustering_methods_list, clustering_details_list, cluster_names_list, file_name, file_format, clustered_column='Hardness', caller_id=None, show_contour_clustered=True, show_contour_raw=True, show_bar=True, remove_outliers=False, save_contour_clustered=False, give_cluster_report=False, print_to_console=False, print_to_text_file=False, text_report_name='RunReport.txt', clusters_save_dir='/ClusterPlots', rand_index_save_dir='/RandIndexVisualization', text_files_save_dir='/TextFiles', data_save_dir='/ClusteredData', cluster_fraction_save_dir='/ClusterInfoHistograms', save_rand_index_visualizations=False, additional_outlier_clusters=False, show_rand_index_plots=False, save_cluster_histograms=False, decon_dir='/DeconvolutionPlots', save_clustered_data=False)¶
Parameters

  • clustering_methods_list – The clustering methods we are using for our clustering, see StringDefinitionsHelper for options

  • clustering_details_list – The details associated with the clustering methods we are using for our clustering methods, see StringDefinitionsHelper.py and ClusteringHelper.py for details

  • cluster_names_list – How to identify the clusters for print reports

  • file_name – The name of the file we are reading in relative to the folder of the executable

  • file_format – The format of the file we are reading in, see StringDefinitionsHelper for options

  • clustered_column – The name of the type of column we are clustering, default value of Hardness

  • caller_id – #TODO Eric describe this

  • show_contour_clustered – A boolean of whether or not to show the final clustered data’s contour plot

  • show_contour_raw – A boolean of whether or not to show the raw data’s contour plot

  • show_bar – A boolean of whether or not to show the bar graph

  • remove_outliers – A boolean of whether or not to remove outliers

  • save_contour_clustered – A boolean of whether or not save the clustered contour plot

  • give_cluster_report – A boolean of whether or not to print out a report of the clusters’ details

  • print_to_console – A boolean of whether or not to print out information to the console

  • print_to_text_file – A boolean of whether or not to print out information to a text file

  • text_report_name – The file path to save the text file to

  • clusters_save_dir – The directory to save the clustered figures to

  • rand_index_save_dir – The directory to save the rand index visualization figures to

  • text_files_save_dir – The directory to save the text files to

  • data_save_dir – The directory to save the data files to

  • cluster_fraction_save_dir – The directory to save the histograms which highlight cluster fractions to

  • save_rand_index_visualizations – A boolean of whether or not to save the rand index visualization

  • additional_outlier_clusters – A boolean of whether to place any outliers into separate clusters

  • show_rand_index_plots – A boolean of whether to show the rand index visualization plots or not

  • save_cluster_histograms – A boolean of whether or not to save the cluster fraction histograms

  • decon_dir – The directory to save the deconvolution plots in

  • save_clustered_data – A boolean of whether or not to save the clustered data

Returns

Nothing at the moment

Reads in all of the data and performs the necessary clustering. It performs the following steps: Reading in the data, preprocessing the data, clustering the data, an then analyzing the data. The the respective helper classes for more details as to how the processes work.
